narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: The course was well organized. The assignments were challenging and perhaps could have been sequenced in a more didactic way. T Here seemed to be a bit of a disjuncture between the difficulty of the first three assignments and the final two.

I thought the course was great - it was a nice balance of history, technical information about classical drawing, and student exploration. The assignments were sequenced nicely, built upon one another and growing in complexity, and produced some nice drawings in the end.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: I took the course as an opportunity to continue drawing since the curriculum offers few choices in that area. It was as expected although I would have thought the assignments to be a bit more refined and thus allowing for an opportunity to choose more technical/labor intensive methods of production (technical drawing rather than computer) for the final projects.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: The course was a good opportunity to take a first/final look at classical drawing and design.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: I would recommend only one extended 'analytique' for the course and more time spent on the technical aspects of the course (ruling pens, drafting, watercolor, etc) in place of the extended lectures or even the computer techniques which I think most student are more apt at than more traditional drawing techniques.
